comments:
eclipse.buildId=I20050125-0800
java.version=1.4.2_03
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en
Framework arguments:  -showlocation
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -clean -showlocation -
nl en


See attached picture.  For some reason on of the dates in the Error Log is not 
formatted correctly.  Very strange.

Created an attachment (id=17504)
Screenshot of error log

Red box outlines problem with dates.

From the context menu of the log view, please open the actual log file in a 
text editor and report back what the date for that odd entry looks like.

This will help us determine if Core is writing the date differently or if PDE 
is mangling the date when it parses it..
alternately, you can just attach the log...

I closed eclipse (after opening the bug report) and opened it again to get 
this info for you but now the date appears correctly in the error log and the 
date in the event details is 2005-01-27 08:28:39,437.

Note also that the subitem was not showing in the attached screen shot of 
error log.  When I reopened Eclipse, the item had a + beside it and showed the 
sub item.

if the log file is of reasonable size, please attach it in full.
Otherwise, please email it to me.  
Thank you.

Created an attachment (id=17505)
The hwole log file

I remember now.  The runtime, relatively recently, changed the format of the 
date to yyyy-mm-dd, while PDE still formats it MMM DD, YYYY.  Sometimes, it 
succeeds, and sometimes it doesn't.

Konrad, please make it go away.

My good friend Wassim pointed out this bug as something I fixed while tending to
Bug 79248, which was coincidentally reported by my good friend Konrad :)

Already released to head.   Please resolve as fixed :)
